Params[3]: Huh?
Psh, what d'you mean, "can I handle it"?
No one but Karenina can handle this, is what you say!
Karenina takes apart the bottom shell of the CPF with practiced ease and gets down to work with the equipment at hand.
...Who's on this channel?
...Have you reactivated the CPF?
...So what does Babylonia plan to do with us?
I dare say your cities won't have a place for us scavengers.
It's fine, we're used to it. We do your dirty work, you give us your scraps. If there are no scraps, we wander and pick over the scraps that belong to the dead.
You give us a fair price, we'll leave.
...Why?

Params[2]: This deal sound fair to you?

Params[3]: ...This can't be real.
Besides the Forsaken that sometimes passed by, no one's...ever treated us like this.
I can't bring myself to trust you.

Params[2]: ...have the rest of your lives to learn to trust.

Params[3]: I heard you liberated Southwood Road?
You gotta be careful, then.
After all... the first time we liberated Southwood Road... we were as proud as you were.
...Nothing. My advice stands.
I still suggest you to get rid of this ticking time bomb as soon as you can. That is all.
It's not that they don't trust people... I prefer to say that they "have no concept of trust."
Be careful. Babylonia is not the only one who've made deals with them.
